skillTree.localised_description: Abhorash's battle with the Imperial Dragon granted more than just a cure for hunger...
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.

skillTree.localised_name: Summon Warriors of Old: Knights of Blood Keep
skillTree.localised_description: Let your blade be your only truth, let death be your only answer, and let your quest be for naught but to become more than what you are.

effects.description: Ability: "Summon Warriors of Old: Knights of Blood Keep"

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Summon Warriors of Old: Knights of Blood Keep

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: It's An Endless Abyss
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
This one will not go down easily – it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
An omen, a sign - this being knows things and any who follow will share their glory.
Never to be broken or dishonoured – never to succumb to the foe.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
A hybrid of familar and new magics, the disiples of abhorash have new and powerful tools to stay in the fight.

skillTree.localised_description: Made to embrace vampirism through deceipt, only final anguished breaths of the dying dragon could give final release from the ever present hunger.

skillTree.localised_description: Many mortal champions change their attitude when their proud challenge is accepted by a dark creature whose very eyes are the eyes of death…
Abhorash's travels have brought him to all lands where exotic and new spells and combat forms could be learned

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.
A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.
Once slain in battle, the foe belongs to the Undead Lord, and will rise again, eager to serve.

attributes.bullet_text:
Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
